intro_text: r_c encounters monster kelp.
decline_text: The patrol steers clear of the dangerous plant.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol examines the monster kelp, eventually deciding that they shouldn't risk the potential injury it could cause.
The monster kelp rustles its leaves, the patrol heeds its warning and gives it space.

s_c sets up an ambush, devising a use the monster kelp to {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} advantage. When a large centipede wanders too close, they attack it fiercely with a spear, collecting it's bounty instead.  The Clan will be impressed by this hefty fresh-kill.

s_c has the ingenious idea to use rocks on the monster kelp from a distance and collect dropped leaves to bring back to camp. The leaves could be woven into the Clan's defenses as intimidation, though {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} decides to wear some leaves on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} pelt.

r_c jumps into action, throwing a spear and seperating a large chunk of the stalk from the stem. As a prize of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss}'s victory, r_c decides to wear some leaves on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelt.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c leaps back just as the monster kelp whips towards {PRONOUN/r_c/object}! That was close! The patrol gives the monster kelp a wide berth.

s_c gets closer to the monster kelp, intending to impress the rest of the patrol with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} bravery. All the slugcats recoil as it swings towards them with a new respect for the predator.

r_c doesn't react quickly enough to the monster kelp's warning. It swings sideways at {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, its grabbing mouth ready to drag an unfurtunate slugcat to it's doom! r_c is badly injured and dies a few days later from the wounds.

intro_text: While hunting, r_c comes across a eggbug burrow.
decline_text: r_c decides to ignore the burrow.

success_outcomes.text: r_c catches the eggbug hiding in its burrow.

fail_outcomes.text: The burrow is abandoned, with no prey to be found in there.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a scavenger nest in the woods while hunting.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol has a successful hunt, avoiding any scavengers.
The patrol finds some astonishingly fat lantern mice running around the scavenger nest and helps themselves to one.

fail_outcomes.text: Scavenger slugpups scare the patrol away.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger slugpups wandering around are unimpressed by the patrol and chase the slugcats for fun.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A scavenger slugpup approaches the patrol, and they send it away squawking with its blood on their claws.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a acavenger nest in the woods while hunting.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol slugcats split up, using sentries to ensure that the scavengers don't disturb their hunts.

fail_outcomes.text: Scavenger slugpups stomp through the woods, scaring away prey and ruining the hunt.

intro_text: The patrol notices a commotion and finds two lanternmice chasing each other across the forest floor.
decline_text: The patrol decides there's probably easier prey to find elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The lanternmice are so distracted that the patrol is able to quickly catch them both.
The patrol springs onto the lanternmice without a second thought, easily dispatching them.
s_c is quick on the jump! Though the lanternmice notice the slugcats and begin scampering away, s_c easily cuts them off and kills both lanternmice.

fail_outcomes.text: The lanternmice are far too excited and quick - they slip right out from between the patrol's claws.

s_c runs at the lanternmice before anyone else can pounce, laughing at the prey's antics and playfully jumping into the middle of their game.  The lanternmice scatter away at the disturbance and disappear into the canopy.
r_c tries to climb up after them but slips and falls, twisting {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paw.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar after trying to chase some lanternmice up a tree.

intro_text: The patrol finds a small burrow in the ground with a strange scent. They hesitate, unsure if this is worth checking.
decline_text: The patrol decides to avoid the burrow. There's no telling what could await inside.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol flushes a yeek out of the burrow! More fresh-kill!
Inside the burrow is an eggbug, curled up and alone. Perhaps a youngling recently kicked from their birth warren? Whatever the case, this eggbug will feed the Clan now.

fail_outcomes.text: The burrow turns out to be empty, the smell nothing but stale air and a slight tang of sickness. Whatever used to live here is gone now. Checking the burrow was a waste of time.
s_c sticks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose into the hole only to disturb a large patch of spore puffs! The whole patrol is covered by stinky spores!

Oh no! The burrow was home to a black lizard, now angry at the disturbance. The patrol bolts away to escape its wrath, but r_c doesn't quite move fast enough and is caught in its claws until another slugcat turns back to help.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after an unfortunate encounter with a black lizard.

intro_text: The patrol hears distant hissinng and wonders whether to investigate the noise.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to investigate the source of the noise.  Whatever is making it will not be friendly to them.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol tracks the noise and discovers a cyan lizard scavenging off a carcass. This is a predator they cannot fight. The patrol decides to return to camp and report the intruder to the leader instead. Perhaps they can return later to take what the cyan lizard leaves behind.
The patrol tracks the noise and finds a mostly stripped carcass covered in the scent of cyan lizard. They quickly scavenge what little is left and leave before the predator can return.

The patrol follows the noise to a cyan lizard who quickly spots them in the brush. A fight ensues and thanks to the skills of s_c, the lizard eventually runs away, deeming the carcass they had been scavenging from to not be worth the hassle.  The patrol brings back what meat had still been left.

The noise leads them to a cyan lizard, scavenging from a carcass. s_c instructs them to wait in the brush, downwind from the lizard, until it leaves. Eventually the lizard eats its fill and disappears into the forest. When s_c deems it safe, the patrol takes their turn stripping the leftover meat from the bones.

fail_outcomes.text: The noise leads them to a cyan lizard that's busy stripping the last of the meat from a carcass. The patrol waits till the lizard leaves, hoping to pick up any leftovers, but unfortunately the bones have been thoroughly cleaned.

They track the noise to a cyan lizard. Before the patrol can investigate further, s_c whimpers in terror at the sight of the beast and dashes away.  The patrol follows anxiously, not wanting to lose sight of their Clanmate while a lizard is about.

The patrol finds a cyan lizard at the source of the noise. It seems to be scavenging from an old carcass and upon seeing the slugcats, prove to be fiercely protective of its meal.  The patrol doesn't move fast enough and r_c is killed before they can run.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by a cyan lizard protecting its scavenged meal.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died of shock after {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} encounter with the Dover Demon.
history_text.lead_death: died of shock from an encounter with the Dover Demon

intro_text: As they wander, searching for prey, p_l finds something far more dangerous, and calls the rest of the patrol over for a lesson.
decline_text: No one wants to get anywhere near the dangerous traps, not even to learn about them.

success_outcomes.text: These scavenger traps are powerful and dangerous, p_l instructs. Strong enough to hold a rabid lizard and with gaps so small not even a flickering plume of scorching fire could escape, no slugcat should ever wander into their metal jaws. They bring only a little bit of prey home, but the lesson is worth the time it took away from hunting.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l has to pull app1 out by the tail, and loudly scolds {PRONOUN/app1/object} all the way back to camp. scavenger traps aren't cool, and app1 has just proven {PRONOUN/app1/self} an idiot, not a brave warrior.
